metadata.name: Evalina and the Sea Lion
metadata.description:
We may find ourselves reaching for—or reacting to—a mysterious inspiration. An inspiration that can seem isolating, as if you're cast away. To be cast away as defined—to be thrown away or rejected—is a frightening thing to consider. Alternatively, being cast away as an experiment in isolation can be contemplative, motivating, and peaceful.

In 1989, at age 22, I cast myself off to an Alaskan unknown.

In 2018, my daughter Evalina stepped into her own Alaskan adventure, to study marine biology.

We made this on her first day in Alaska.
